name: How Well Do You Know Movies? 2 Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Will Ferrell and Nicole Kidman show us their acting talents in which movie?
questions.explanation:
Bewitched.

	"Bewitched" (2005) is a movie about a star who has faded from the minds of many. He is hoping to star in a remake of the popular TV show "Bewitched" that aired quite a long time ago. In doing this, he plans to gain fame once more. Jack (Will Ferrell), finds Isabel (Nicole Kidman), who is perfect for the role of Samantha. She is a real witch however, who wants to live a normal life. In other words, a witch trying to give up magic is acting as a witch who wants to give up magic, and this can get quite confusing.

questions.text: Chris Rock and Anthony Hopkins make us laugh in which of the following movies?
questions.explanation:
Bad Company.

	"Bad Company" (2002) is a movie about twins, neither of whom know that the other exists. One twin is killed while on a top-secret mission for the CIA. The other (Chris Rock) is paid a lot of money by an agent (Anthony Hopkins) to take his place, and enter the deadly game to save New Jersey and New York from a nuclear bomb that might kill millions. It is an action movie, that is also quite comical.

questions.text: Cate Blanchett and Leonardo DiCaprio soar to the skies in which of the following movies?
questions.explanation:
The Aviator.

	Howard Hughes (Leonardo DiCaprio) who was among the richest men in the world in his time, is a ladies' man who meets many women throughout his complicated life. To make things worse, his company, TWA, is becoming weak in the face of competition from PanAm. His Obsessive Compulsive Disorder will make him weaker and more vulnerable, until his life reaches a sudden drop.

questions.text: The lights are punched out by Hillary Swank and Morgan Freeman in which of the following movies?
questions.explanation:
Million Dollar Baby.

	"Million Dollar Baby" (2004) was a real winner at the Oscars. It features a girl (Hillary Swank), who is approaching her 33rd birthday, and is determined to prove herself as a boxing star. She is taken on by one of the greatest coaches boxing has ever seen (Clint Eastwood), and she becomes a star, fighting in every corner of the globe. Warning: Do not watch this movie if you hate sad endings.  The special thing about this movie is its luck at the Oscars. It was nominated for Best Picture, and it received it. Hilary Swank was nominated for Best Actress, and she got the title. Clint Eastwood was nominated for Best Actor, however Jamie Foxx was able to take it. Morgan Freeman was nominated for best Supporting Actor, and he got it. Finally, Clint Eastwood was nominated of Best Director. This movie took 4 of the greatest honours that Hollywood has to offer!

questions.text: Julianne Moore and Pierce Brosnan portray characters in which of the following movies?
questions.explanation:
Laws of Attraction.

	Two divorce lawyers (Julianne Moore and Pierce Brosnan), who work against each other continually in every case, start to get on each other's nerves. They end up drunk and married while on a trip to Ireland, and the fact that a "married couple" are facing each other in court really triggers the press. This get much more complicated when they realize that they might not be married.

questions.text: Jamie Foxx and Tom Cruise make some music in "Ray".
questions.explanation:
False.

	Jamie Foxx and Tom Cruise played together the movie "Collateral" (2004). Jamie Foxx plays a cab driver in Los Angeles. Tom Cruise, plays a hitman who enters Foxx's car, and demands that Foxx kill all the victims he himself has been paid to assassinate."Ray" (2004), however, is a musical about the life of Ray Charles (Jamie Foxx), the famous jazz music legend who died in 2004. Jamie Foxx plays the main role and he dazzled fans and audiences in this wonderful musical. It shows us how the blind and talented singer overcomes his drug addictions, and becomes a jazz legend.Jamie Foxx won Best Actor in both his Oscar and Golden Globe nominations.

questions.text: In which movie do Julia Roberts and George Clooney steal our breath with every move they make?
questions.explanation:
Ocean's Eleven.

	Danny Ocean (George Clooney) is a man who has just been released from jail. He promises not to steal anymore, and that is the only reason he is released. He was divorced from his wife (Julia Roberts), and has many social problems. Even though he is taking a great risk, he plans to steal a large amount of money from the casinos in Las Vegas.To make all of this worse, the man who he is planning to steal from, is in love with his ex-wife.

questions.text: Nikki Reed and Evan Rachel Wood perform in which of the following movies?
questions.explanation:
Thirteen.

	In this movie, Tracy (played by Wood), wants to be cool and join in the activities of the more popular kids in her school. Nikki Reed plays Eevie, the "hottest girl" in the school. Eevie hangs around with some bad people, and she has some unfortunate habits that she will eventually transmit to Tracy, who sees her as nothing less than an idol.

questions.text: Tom Hanks and Christopher Walken dazzle us in which of the following movies?
questions.explanation:
Catch Me if you Can.

	We really don't know what his name is. Frank Abignail Jr. (Leonardo DiCaprio) is a teenager who has the incredible talent of tricking men and women into giving him money. Before he is nineteen years old, he steals over 2 million dollars, and impersonates a doctor, a lawyer, and a pilot. Walken plays Frank Abignail Sr. and Tom Hanks plays the investigator trying to catch young Frank, only that will probably be a very difficult job.

questions.text: This amazing Ewan McGregor and Renee Zellweger movie gets us up on our feet clapping. What is its name again?
questions.explanation:
Down With Love.

	Catcher Block (Ewan McGregor) has dated more women than he can count. He is being publicly embarrassed on TV by an international best-selling author. This woman (Renee Zellweger) states that her book says "no" to love, and "yes" to being a free woman. Block wants to charm the author so that she will love him, and then he can prove to the world that she, of all people, can actually fall in love. Only there are many twists and turns he doesn't expect.
